trends: There have been 136 other sightings in Toronto
There were no other sightings in Toronto on or around June 26th 2005
divs: sighting details1. my wife and i were sitting in backyard patio looking up at night sky 2. was a formation of 4-5 luminescent triangular objects traveling silently (no sound)and extremely rapidly northbound, one object was a bit "wobbly" - were not airplanes (we see commercial airtrafic at night on regular basis) 3. at first we were not sure what we were seeing, honestly i wondered if it was a flock of bird being lit from underneath gliding over us - but they moved too fast and were not "flapping" and were more triangular than a bird or airplane 4. weird aerial events started at 11:50pm. it was a group of 4-5 objects triangular in shape all luminescent underneath (a hazy lit grey - solid - no blinking lites or anything in terms of coloration one sees on commercial air traffic). my wife and i had no idea what the objects were either but they were flying in formation - no doubt about that, one appeared to wobble badly then corrected itself in flight. both my wife and i agreed they were odd and "ufo" like. we only caught site of them as they flew overhead rapidly heading from the south -northbound and we lost them in trees as they progressed. moments later as we moved to try to see into the distance we saw two more coming from the southeast heading northward. we continued to watch the skys and at 11:20pm i noticed a bright light (thought it was a star at first) rapidly move northbound (appeared to be much, much higher than the "triangles") it moved i called my wifes attention to it and we both saw it travel rapidly in a straight line from south to north disappearing from our view as it progressed across the sky. more strange aerial phenomenon continued - at aproximately 11:50am i noticed another star like light (again very high) this time travelling from the western part of the sky east, (much faster than the northbound one)again i called my wifes attention to it and it passed overhead and we lost it (our house obstucted us from viewing further as the object passed over it continuing eastward. the two "travelling stars" were traveling at a very high rate of speed - covering too much sky in too litle time to be an airplane (even one traveling near supersonic). from almost directly overhead until i lost it in the trees the northbound "traveling star" crossed sky until out of sight in about 20 - 30 seconds max, the other travelling eastbound was out of sight within 10 seconds easily. all objects were silent. the "traveling stars" were traveling in precise straight lines. finally at 12:05pm just before going into the house to say goodnight my wife and i both witnessed 2 more luminescent triangles flying in formation from the south east going northbound - this time they seemed to vanish just after we lost sight of them going past some treetops across the road. 5. my wife is more of a skeptic than i am, she admits to seeing ufos but is not sure who\what those ufos were. i was excited and fascinated, she was more reserved and quite quiet about the whole thing. 6. objects passed into the horizon overtop trees and buildings - we lost sight of them then. it was amazing to see some things frankly i never thought i would experience with my wife in my lifetime. but to see all the wierd aerial activity in one night was quite bizarre. i'm deathly curious what ground radar reported (if you can find out).
Summary: 4 luminescent triangles northbound, 2 more sighted twice, two other strange lights...
